DIRECTOR OF FINANCE
Professional Summary
Seeking a position in financial/general accounting.
Highly meticulous and reliable Finance Director with an outstanding client service record.
Adept multitasker able to handle a number of cash management projects with professionalism and accuracy.
Strong research skills in optimizing current and efficient cash management team operation.

Develop and monitor policies and procedures within generally accepted accounting principles and corporate guidelines to ensure sufficient cash flow, reduced operating cost, and increased revenues.
Forecast, monitor performance and prepare analytical information and management reports to enable effective decision making by the CEO.
Manage and develop clear and precise financial records, analyze financial statement while ensuring the integrity of all financials, and maintain internal control.
Manages monthly and yearly closing responsibilities including system closing, journal entry preparation and inventory reconciliation.
Prepare and review all documentation required to meet reporting deadlines.

Serve as primary liaison to outside CPA firm for assurance and income tax preparation services.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Chief Financial Officer

Location: Buffalo, WY

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, Sales

Description:
LOCATION: Preferable Buffalo Branch but will consider Bank's other branch markets for ideal Candidate. (Sheridan, Gillette, Douglas, Newcastle) SUMMARY/OBJECTIVE:The Chief Financial Officer serves as the Bank’s lead financial executive, overseeing and representing the Accounting Department and all financial and accounting operations. The position adheres to all related generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP), tax and regulatory laws, rules, and regulations to adequately and accurately reflect the Bank’s financial position. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:Prepares, presents, and submits budgets, financial forecasting, audited financial statements, and periodic regulatory filings (Call Report, FR Y-6, FR Y-9, etc.).In conjunction with the Bank’s Chief Credit Officer, oversees the establishment of methodology and prepares the Allowance for Credit Loss (ACL) calculation under the current and expected credit loss (CECL) framework.Maintain relationships with correspondent banks and regulators.Oversees and manages the Bank’s asset/liability processes and procedures, including short and long-term liquidity, funding, capital planning, interest rate risk strategy, etc.Serves as Chair of the Bank’s Asset/Liability Committee (ALCO).Oversees the bank’s accounts payable process, authorizes asset purchases for the bank, and works with the controller (or equivalent) to manage capital expenditures, budgeting, and purchasing processes.Participates in evaluating potential merger and acquisition (M&A) candidates and coordinates the preparation of M&A financial projections.Coordinates holding company financial duties in conjunction with HC Treasurer, including preparation of annual ESOP share valuation, quarterly dividend payments, timely filing of holding company tax returns, filings, and related reporting.Additional duties as assigned as it relates to the position.
LEADERSHIP AND MANAGEMENT RESPONSIBILITIES
Carry out supervisory responsibilities per Bank policies and applicable employment laws.Mentor and coach direct reports as they work to achieve performance goals in their respective roles.Regularly review the job performance of direct reports and assist in reviewing department employees to ensure expectations are met, efficiencies are identified, and all necessary employee development is recognized. Ensure all performance reviews, goals, and feedback are completed in the HRIS system.Manage turnover to ensure and promote employee longevity and continuity.Provide opportunities for promotion from within to increase employee loyalty.Plays a positive role in the development and growth of assigned department staff through excellent verbal and written communication skills and strong delegation skills, assuring a highly cross-trained staff.
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS
A bachelor’s degree in finance, accounting, or a related field; CPA preferred but not required.A minimum of ten years of experience in financial institution accounting, auditing, financial management, or any closely related field, preferably in a community banking environment.A minimum of two years of supervisory experience.Intermediate knowledge of general accounting, payroll, budgeting, and related accounting and record-keeping systems in a financial institution.Advanced knowledge of related state and federal banking compliance regulations, as well as bank accounting policies and procedures.Proficiency in financial software and tools, including Microsoft Excel and/or financial modeling software.Intermediate skills related to the consolidation and reporting of Bank financial results, formulation, and implementation of Bank accounting procedures.High level of leadership ability and management skills.High level of professionalism, confidentiality, service, and community spirit.Exceptional verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills.Excellent ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, draw valid conclusions, and interpret financial reports, government regulations, and legal documents.Self-motivated and persistent in following through and learning quickly.Independent decision maker within authority limits.Commitment and continuous demonstration of ethical behavior and willingness to adhere to all company policies and current financial legislation.
SUPERVISORYThis position has direct supervisory responsibilities and may serve as a mentor for other positions in the organization.
WORKING CONDITIONSNormal office environment.While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand, walk, use hands to type, carry, handle, and feel objects, reach with hands and arms, and talk or hear. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds or more with assistance. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.Multitask; perform tasks in an open office environment with noise from conversations, office machines, or other distracting sounds.Keep track of assigned tasksOccasionally may be exposed to upset customers during everyday activities or work under stress caused by anxious or impatient customers. First Northern Bank is committed to equal opportunity for all, without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, veteran status, disability, genetic information, or any other protected characteristics. First Northern Bank will make reasonable accommodations for known physical or mental limitations of otherwise qualified employees and applicants with disabilities unless the accommodation would impose an undue hardship on the operation of our business. If you are interested in applying for an employment opportunity and feel you need a reasonable accommodation pursuant to the ADA, please contact us at 307-684-2211.
*The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.This document describes the general content and performance requirements of this job. It is not to be construed as an exhaustive statement of duties, responsibilities, or requirements and does not imply a
BambooHR

Experience Level (if available): None
<JD_END>
